application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The replacement trees must be planted on or near the existing tree by April 2025; the replacement for trees 600, 601, 370, 380, 365, 830 can be of any species of your choice but of a size not less than 10-12cm girth when planted.

Reason: To ensure the continued amenity provided by the tree(s) and the planting of an appropriate species and in order to preserve the character and appearance of this part of Grange and White Ledges conservation area. | The tree work specified above must be carried out within 2 years of the date of this decision.

Reason: To ensure the work is only carried out once in respect of this consent and allow Ealing Council the opportunity to reconsider its decision in the light of prevailing circumstances, and reconsult on the case in the event of the consent expiring before implementation.
description:
Tree Preservation Order
T596 Pedunculate oak - Remove small, fractured branch at 9m east side.
CH05 T178 - T600 Silver Birch - Fell.
T601 Ornamental cherry - Fell.
T830 Ornamental apple - Fell.
CH01 T39 - T603 Red oak - Remove deadwood and reduce crown by 1-2 metres.
CH06 T199 - T849, Crack Willow - Re-pollard back to previous pollard points.
CH02 G6 - T307, Holly - Reduce stems to 5 metres in height.
CH04 T138 - T365 Lime - Fell.
CH04 T157 - T370 Silver Maple - Fell.
CH05 G9 - T380 Hawthorn - Fell.
CH04 T133 - T595 Blue Atlas Cedar - Reduce crown by 2 metres.
CH02 T47 - T319 Hornbeam - Cut back branches to by 1 metre from lamp column.
CH02 T59 - T322 Hornbeam - Clear secondary growth from street column retaining scaffold limb.
T384 Pedunculate Oak - fell.
CH05 T186 - T873 London Plane - Crown lift 2-3 metres over footpath.
CH05 G10 - T878 London Plane - Crown lift 2-3 metres over footpath.
